CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Student Discounts relative to Flash Sale Subscribers?
SRP.A: Student Discounts is {above} Flash Sale Subscribers in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Flash Sale Subscribers relative to Student Discounts?
SRP.A: Flash Sale Subscribers is {below} Student Discounts in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total loyalty program growth?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Student Discounts}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total loyalty program growth?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Flash Sale Subscribers}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Flash Sale Subscribers's minimum Loyalty Program Growth in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Flash Sale Subscribers's minimum Loyalty Program Growth is in {2000}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Student Discounts's maximum Loyalty Program Growth in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Student Discounts's maximum Loyalty Program Growth is in {2004}.

NC.Q: Was the total Loyalty Program Growth in 1993 higher or lower than in 2004?
NC.A: The total loyalty program growth in 1993 was {lower} than in 2004.

NC.Q: Between 1995 and 2000, was the average total Loyalty Program Growth higher or lower than between 2001 and 2002?
NC.A: The average total loyalty program growth between 1995 and 2000 was {higher} than between 2001 and 2002.

NC.Q: Between 1993 and 1995, did the total Loyalty Program Growth experience a larger or smaller change than between 1997 and 2003?
NC.A: The change in total loyalty program growth between 1993 and 1995 was {larger} than between 1997 and 2003.

NC.Q: Between 1994 and 1998, was the average total Loyalty Program Growth higher or lower than between 1993 and 2001?
NC.A: The average total loyalty program growth between 1994 and 1998 was {higher} than between 1993 and 2001.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Student Discounts} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Flash Sale Subscribers and Student Discounts first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Flash Sale Subscribers and Student Discounts first exchanged leading positions in {1995}.
